div.head: 海水傷裂
div.div: skin cracks as damage caused by ocean water

bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

entry.def: skin cracks as damage caused by ocean water

sense.def: Pathological Condition of injured, cracked and painful skin brought forth by ocean salt water. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry jiu 酒 quotes Shi liu qiu lu 使琉球錄 : 海水傷裂：凡人為海水咸物所傷，及風吹裂，痛不 可忍 , “ Skin cracks as damage caused by ocean water : whenever wind blows into the skin cracks of a person injured by salty matter in ocean water, the pain is unbearable”. Han 寒 , cold [p]

① Alternative Names leng 冷 ; han qi 寒氣 , cold qi; han leng 寒冷 , cold; leng qi 冷氣 , cold qi; han xie 寒邪. Etiological Agent. capable of causing cold-type disease. Su wen 素問 72: 寒淫於內，治以甘 熱 , “If cold has encroached upon the interior, this is treated with sweet [flavor] and hot [qi]”.

② Alternative Names han leng 寒冷 , cold; leng qi 冷氣 , cold qi; han bing 寒病 , cold disease; han ji 寒疾 , cold ailments; leng bing 冷病 , cold disease; leng ji 冷疾 , cold ailment; leng zheng 冷證 . Pathological Condition of unilateral dominance of yin and cold brought forth by different causes. Su wen 素問 5: 陰勝則寒 , “When the yin dominates, there is cold ”. ③ Alternative Names cold condition; shen leng 身冷 , bodily cold; ti han 體寒 , bodily cold. Illness Sign of a low temperature in the external parts of the body, or of a subjectively felt cold. Su wen 素問 5: 身常清，數栗而寒 , “The body is permanently cool. One shivers frequently and feels cold ”. ④ Alternative Names leng 冷. Pharmacological Quality referring to one of the four types of qi in pharmaceutical substances. Shen nong ben cao jing 神農本草經 Xu li 序例：[藥]有寒、熱、温、涼四氣 , “[Drugs] have the four qi of cold , heat, warmth, and coolness”. ⑤ Therapeutic Approach of treating disease with pharmaceutical substances of a cold and cool nature. Su wen 素問 74: 熱者寒之 , “Treat heat with cold ”.
